attributes.action: Stop the UK government's plans for internet censorship.
attributes.additional_details:
This is a scary first step to the government censorship of the internet. It is not about the pornography, but about the implications of restricting access to our freedom on the internet. 
https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2016/nov/23/censor-non-conventional-sex-acts-online-internet-pornography
No politician wants to be the politician who was 'pro-porn', but we must stand up to this, as it is nothing more than censorship in disguise.
attributes.background: The UK's government's new plans for the censorship of pornography is a terrifying reality. It includes the ban of legal acts between consenting adults under the 'Obscene Publications Act'. There is no reason for the government to dictate what consenting adults may watch.

rejection.details:
Petitions need to call on the Government or Parliament to take a specific action. You could start a new petition explaining clearly what you would like the Government or Parliament to do.

Alternatively, you may wish to sign this petition:

https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/174167
